DOC.HEAD: Transplant Patient Dies
DOC.TEXT: Doctors were trying to learn why a 2-year-old boy died after twice receiving split livers in transplants. Mitchell Wallace of Hannibal, N.Y., died Saturday of multiple systems failure, said Margie Buczynski, a spokeswoman for Children's Hospital of Pittsburgh. She said doctors planned to perform tests to determine what caused the failure. A lack of available donor organs led doctors to try the split-liver transplants, which are possible because the organs regenerate themselves. Mitchell received his first split liver Nov. 29, but the liver did not function properly, doctors said. On Wednesday, doctors split one liver to transplant into Mitchell and a 3-year-old child, whom the hospital did not identify at the parents' request. The 3-year-old was in serious condition late Saturday, Ms. Buczynski said. Hospital officials would not release the child's condition Sunday. Before the operations, Mitchell had suffered from liver failure of unknown origin. He was found to have hepatitis after his own liver was removed.
